meanings.sent1: The house had a gabled roof that sloped down on both sides.
meanings.sent2: The old barn was gabled, with its triangular roof reaching high above.
meanings.sent3: The gabled cat tower provided a stylish perch for the feline residents.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sharp and pointed as a gabled roof.
meanings.sent5: The gabled facade of the building stood out against the flat skyline.

meanings.definition: Constructed with a gable or gables.
meanings.sent1: The gabled structure of the cabin gave it a cozy feel.
meanings.sent2: The church was gabled, showcasing intricate woodwork along its peaks.
meanings.sent3: The gabled gingerbread house looked almost too perfect to be real.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed off the gabled walls of the ancient castle.
meanings.sent5: The gabled entrance welcomed visitors with open arms.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a gable.
meanings.sent1: Her hair fell in gabled waves around her face.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range had a gabled silhouette against the setting sun.
meanings.sent3: The gabled clouds in the sky seemed to mimic the rooftops below.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had a gabled quality that echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The gabled hills rolled gently into the distance.
